title: Pokemon TCG Amazon-Exclusive Premium Collection Restocked On Cyber Monday
description: Pokemon TCG: Blaziken ex & Volcanion ex Premium Collection $70 | Amazon Holiday 2025 Exclusive See at Amazon Amazon has restocked its Holiday 2025 Pokemon Trading Card Game Premium Collection on Cyber Monday. The Blaziken ex & Volcanion ex Premium Collection debuted on Amazon in late August and promptly sold out. It was restocked in October and, once again, sold out within a day. If you're interested, you should grab one while you can. This Premium Collection comes with 10 Booster Packs, two foil promo cards, and an oversized foil card. Pokemon TCG: Blaziken ex & Volcanion ex Premium Collection $70 | Amazon Holiday 2025 Exclusive The Blaziken ex & Volcanion ex Premium Collection comes with foil promo cards of each Pokemon, an oversized foil card featuring Blaziken ex, and 10 Pokemon Trading Card Game Booster Packs with 10 cards each. Here's the full breakdown of this Amazon-exclusive Premium Collection: Blaziken ex Oversized Foil Card Blaziken ex Foil Card Volcanion ex Foil Card 5 Scarlet & Violet: Journey Together Booster Packs 5 Scarlet & Violet: Destined Rivals Booster Packs Pokemon TCG Live code See at Amazon Sign up for GameSpot's Weekly Deals Newsletter: More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Lexar Play Pro 1TB MicroSD Express For Switch 2 Gets Black Friday Discount DualSense Limited Edition PS5 Controllers On Sale For Black Friday Check Out Over 200 Nintendo Switch Game Deals For Black Friday + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5) Eight Nintendo Switch Exclusives Are 50% Off In Walmart's Black Friday Sale The First PS5 Pro Deal In Six Months Is Up For Grabs For A Limited Time Ghost Of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundles And Collector's Edition Get Huge Discounts Save Big On 8BitDo's Stellar Ultimate 2 Controllers In Amazon's Black Friday Sale Evercade Retro Handhelds & Cartridges Get Rare Price Cuts In Amazon's Black Friday Sale

title: Arc Raiders Introduces Hilarious New Fix For Locked Room Exploits: Burn Everything
description: Arc Raiders players recently discovered an exploit that allowed them to loot locked rooms without needing a keycard. Naturally, the exploit quickly became popular--and frustrating for players who didn't use it--leading Embark Studios to apply a "hot" fix to this part of the game. If you now decide to cheese your way into one of these treasure rooms, you can now expect a toasty reception inside. Using a keycard to access one of these rooms ties into the high-risk, high-reward nature of Arc Raiders, but the exploit essentially bypasses it. Players managed to break into the room, grab valuable gear without worrying about being ambushed, and pick the location clean. This meant that players who unlocked the room properly would find it stripped bare, leading to frustration within the Arc Raiders community. To remedy this, Embark Studios made it so that the rooms automatically activate flamethrowers when you glitch into them. Players quickly found out that they would be caught inside this deathtrap, while other players with keycards would discover a room full of loot and a freshly cremated adventurer. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: See The New Black Ops 7 Maps For Call Of Duty Season 1
description: Season 1 arrives to Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 and Warzone this week, and the first season of content adds plenty of new multiplayer maps. Activision has released a new Black Ops 7 video to showcase the four maps arriving with the launch of Season 1, including three brand-new maps and one remastered. There are seven maps total for Season 1 of Black Ops 7. Four maps arrive with the season's launch on December 4, and three additional maps are included for a midseason update. As shown in the trailer above, Activision gives a flyover of each map, highlighting main points-of-interests for Fate, Utopia, Odysseus, and Black Ops 7's remaster of Standoff from Black Ops 2. Utopia is a brand-new map set at a futuristic Guild research facility based in Australia. This is a medium-sized map for standard 6v6 modes. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Cyberpunk 2077 Is Teasing Something For Its Fifth Anniversary--Here‚Äôs When To Tune In
description: December 10 marks the fifth anniversary of Cyberpunk 2077, and developer CD Projekt is teasing something to mark the occasion. On its social media channels, the company posted a "Cyberpunk 2077 birthday and anniversary calendar" image alongside a cryptic message. "Secure comms channel established. Standby for incoming priority transmission," the message reads, with images of characters and dates accompanying it. The tweet hints at something happening on December 10--the day Cyberpunk 2077 launched in 2020--and another on December 12 linked to Solomon Reed. On December 19, it looks like we'll hear from the songbird herself, Song So Mi. SECURE COMMS CHANNEL ESTABLISHED. STANDBY FOR INCOMING PRIORITY TRANSMISSION‚Ä¶CYBERPUNK 2077 ‚Äî 10.12REED, SOLOMON ‚Äî 12.12SONG, SO MI ‚Äî 29.12END OF TRANSMISSION. pic.twitter.com/3PcagdOjlt ‚Äî Cyberpunk 2077 (@CyberpunkGame) December 1, 2025 So what's CDPR Red teasing? The studio has supported Cyberpunk 2077 extensively since its rocky launch, rolling out major updates to improve the game's quality. These fixes eventually led to the release of the critically acclaimed Phantom Liberty expansion--from which both Reed and Songbird originate--and since then, CDPR has added even more content to the game. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Bayonetta 3 Actor Says She Was "Thrown Under The Bus" After Recasting
description: In 2022, Jennifer Hale was confirmed as the new voice of Bayonetta in Bayonetta 3, following the departure of the character's original voice actress, Hellena Taylor. The recasting of Taylor and the subsequent controversy dogged Hale during the production of that game, and it's an experience she didn't enjoy despite her love for the character. During an interview with GAMINGbible, Hale indicated that she would "love to play Bayonetta again," but she wasn't happy about the situation she found herself in. "I definitely got thrown under the bus by that whole thing, and I was unable to speak on my own behalf because I was under not one but two NDAs," recalled Hale. "Eventually, I was allowed to make a statement, which I appreciated, and I was able to present the facts. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metal Gear Solid Producer Thinks The One Remake You Want Would Be Very Difficult To Make
description: Konami appears to be a little undecided on what to make next now that Metal Gear Solid Delta is out on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Another remake isn't totally out of the realm of possibility, and neither is something wholly brand new, but series producer Noriaki Okamura said that if Konami were to do another remake, Metal Gear Solid 4 would be a "pretty hard" one to do. Speaking to the Japanese website Real Sound (and machine translated by both Eurogamer and VGC), Okamura said that, while he'd love to build on the momentum that the Metal Gear Solid 3 remake gave him and Konami, the team is still at the decision-making stage about what comes next. He expressed that another remake is possible, but so too is something entirely new. After all, with Metal Gear Solid alone, Konami has a rich history to pull from. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fortnite Leak Suggests It'll Get Call Of Duty: Warzone's Most Unique Feature
description: It looks like Fortnite will borrow a feature from one of its competing battle royales, should recently surfaced leaks prove to be accurate. According to prominent Fortnite leaker Shiina, the Epic Games title is adding something very similar to the Gulag from Call of Duty: Warzone. This feature is purportedly called "Restarter Island," and it'll have eliminated players compete in a random 1v1 minigames, with winners respawning back into battle royale matches. One of these minigames is a simple duel, similar to the Gulag system in Warzone, with another described as a best-out-of-three Rock, Paper, Scissors showdown. FIRST LOOK AT THE GULAG IN FORTNITE üî•(via @Egyptian_Leaker & @KPMisParrot) pic.twitter.com/h7P6vKFDu2 ‚Äî Shiina (@ShiinaBR) November 30, 2025 Fellow Fortnite leaker Blortzen adds that other Restarter Island minigames include a "Shockwave Deathmatch," in which players have to use shockwave grenades to knock each other off, and sprint races between players, with one variation adding deadly baseball bats for competitors to use against each other. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Call Of Duty Is Crossing Over With Street Fighter 6, But Not In Black Ops 7
description: Street Fighter 6 characters, such as Ryu and Chun-Li, are coming to Call of Duty Mobile later this month. The crossover will be a part of the shooter's Season 11: 6th Anniversary, with Street Fighter operators arriving December 11, per the game's official X account. There is no official roster of Street Fighter 6 operators announced for Call of Duty Mobile yet, but the trailer for the crossover--seen below--showcases Ryu, Chun-Li, Akuma, Cammy, and Luke. Additionally, a weapon series based on the fighting game is planned to drop December 13 for Call of Duty Mobile. This isn't the first time Call of Duty Mobile has seen a big crossover event. In October, the game got WWE operators like the Undertaker and Alexa Bliss with Season 9: Midnight Rumble. Even earlier this year, in July, the shooter featured a Gundam-themed season, and there was even an unexpected Nier: Automata collaboration. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Tomb Raider TV Series Finds Another Actor Joining Sophie Turner's Lara Croft
description: The Tomb Raider TV series is finally happening, with Sophie Turner set to play the iconic gaming character. But who else will star in the Prime Video series? A report from Variety said British actor Martin Bobb-Semple will be a series regular on the show, though his role was not confirmed. Bobb-Semple is perhaps best known for his recurring roles on All American: Homecoming and One of Us is Lying. Production on the Tomb Raider show is set to begin in January 2026. title: Metal Gear Solid Delta Collector's Edition Gets 50% Discount At Amazon
description: The Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Edition is on sale for 50% off at Amazon for Cyber Monday. The $100 discount is only available for the PS5 edition of the Collector's Edition. This deal probably won't remain in stock for long. Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Edition $100 (was $200) The Snake Eater remake's Collector's Edition comes with a bunch of physical extras, including a Terrarium Diorama and exclusive steelbook case. The diorama recreates a scene from the game's first mission, and the steelbook has Yoji Shinkawa's artwork from the original Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. Here's everything you get with the Collector's Edition: Collector's Box Terrarium Diorama Steelbook Case Snake's ID Card Lanyard Halo Jump Patch Fox Patch Tactical Edition of game In-game content: Sneaking DLC Pack White Tuxedo See at Amazon See at Walmart ($200) Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Edition Continue Reading at GameSpot
